solution_line_template: On the third day, there were one-third of the number of bedbugs as the fourth day, so there were {final_bedbugs} / {growth_factor} = <<{final_bedbugs}/{growth_factor}={bedbugs_day_3}>>{bedbugs_day_3} bedbugs.
On the second day, there were one-third of the third day's bedbugs, so there were {bedbugs_day_3} / {growth_factor} = <<{bedbugs_day_3}/{growth_factor}={bedbugs_day_2}>>{bedbugs_day_2} bedbugs.
On the first day, there were {bedbugs_day_2} / {growth_factor} = <<{bedbugs_day_2}/{growth_factor}={initial_bedbugs}>>{initial_bedbugs} bedbugs in the group to start with.
